A sturdy gate bars the way forward.

Gears align. We seem to keep running into
Before we even begin this conversation, I just
want to make it clear that we will not be
strongarmed into paying you another bribe.
We need to enter the city.
Don't worry, I have no intention of that.
In fact, I need your help. I need someone who I
Why should we help you? You've not exactly
Because the landscape of the situation has
changed. After you left the docks, I received
some unsettling news from one of my agents.
You may be aware of the current troubles
that are going on in the area?
Yes, we had heard about the violence and
And we are still after the thief that I
Funny that you mention that, Kheltari. Would
a sceptre with a golden set stone be the
Yes! How do you know of this? Do you have it?
We've suspected for some time that someone in
the inner workings of the government has been
working to undermine us. The attacks have
What do you mean by that?
Raids happening where the guards are stretched
thin. Convoys attacked at precisely the worst
chokepoints. Civil unrest stoked in the most
desperate of areas. It's as if someone is
able to act without being seen at the highest
levels of our government. I know that as an
outside party, that's unlikely to be you.
Doesn't that remind you of Victoria, Elim?
Your turn to share information - what do you
The queen...my wife...was acting as a double
agent for the dark warlord Sargon. She was
being controlled as an unwitting pawn.
Controlled? How? And isn't Sargon supposed to
Unfortunately he's not as dead as he should be.
We're still investigating how, but know he is
able to control and supplant people that are
part of his bloodline, no matter how distant.
We spoke to Mina in the chapel - her partner
Vlad said that he had suspicions about
someone in the council betraying the city.
We do have suspicions about the council, but
no concrete proof. My agent tailed a hooded
figure leaving the Copper Citadel and out
into the wilderness. There, they were seen
meeting with an unidentified armoured figure,
who was holding a sceptre with a golden stone
The armoured figure - what did it look like?
It must be Kellar, the one I saw in the vision
in the Solar Shrine. He's being used by Sargon
to act in this area. What is he looking for
though? The sword isn't going to be here.
There has to be something here that he needs.
Maybe something else is hampering his efforts.
Edrico, it sounds like we perhaps have common
cause here. Can you grant us passage through
the gate, so that we can investigate?
Yes - you need to make your way to the Copper
Citadel and find out who is acting against us.
From what you say, it sounds as if our enemy
may be one and the same. However, the council
is currently in session and access to the
Citadel is prohibited to the public. Do you
have any other business in the city that you
Elim, remember the necromancer exile cult is
in this city. They may be able to shed some
light on the origins of Sargon's powers.
That's a great idea Feylora, we will go there
first. Edrico, do you know where they are
Not to my knowledge, but before you leave the
gate, there is an information point that advises
what the city has to offer. I advise going
Come and find me in the Copper Citadel when
it reopens. Until then...be vigilant. Thank you

Welcome to Garras. This is the information
desk, what would you like to know about the
There are three members of the ruling council
Solomon Geargrave. They are responsible for
governing not only the city, but the wider
realm of Durast as a whole. Their ruling seats
are in the Copper Citadel, at the northenmost
point of Garras. North of the Copper Crucible.
responsible for governing the citizens of the
realm. He deals with any issues the people at
Councilor Greta Forgehand is a technical
wizard. She has personally designed so many
of the technological marvels you may see in
Councilor Solomon Geargrave is the councillor
who deals with Durast's foreign policy. He is
mostly responsible for dealing with other
All three members of the council work
together to make decisions, not just in their
You're currently at the Foundry gate, the
only public entrance in and out of Garras.
This is at the southernmost point of the city.
To the west is the shopping district, and
north from there is the entertainment district.
Most of the rest of the city are varying
qualities of houses and warehouses. There are
that have taken up residence in the city, but
they aren't required to register with the
council. You'll need to explore a little to
If you get lost, the Copper Crucible is right
at the center of the city, just a little
north from here. You can get most places
For the public, the only way in and out of the
city is through the Foundry Gate, where you
are right now. In terms of the wider area,
there isn't much around Garras for miles,
except for the village of Razak, which is
south east from the city. The clockwork docks
service Castle Altair, and Willow's Way docks.
They also run convoys to Osgoth in the north,
but the Subterranean Waterway is currently
off limits. We've been told by the clockwork
knights that there are adverse weather
conditions, but that's all we know.
In the shopping district, there are shops that
sell weapons, equipment, armour and more. It
changes frequently, so you'd be best to go
You know as much as me - the clockwork knights
seem to think everything is under control
though. Nothing to worry about, don't let it
Take this, it's a tourist's map of the city.
It doesn't give you an exact layout, but it
should help you find your way around.
